content.description: Squat start with hands matched on the edge. From there, climb up and right though a series of good edges to reach a mantle finish.
content.protection: Pad or two. The immediate landing is good, but there are some rocks behind the problem.
content.location: It climbs the north face of Bygone.

content.description: Sit start with hands matched on the obvious, large dish beneath the overhang.  From there, pull on the right heel, work out and up to the incut crimps, fire to the lip, and top it out.
content.protection: A couple of pads, the landing has few bad rocks, but it's not too bad.
content.location: This is on the North face of Bygone Block.

content.description:
Lub Dub climbs an overhung arete on good quality rock over an equally good landing. The problem itself is forced, as the lip is off until the crater is reached. Still worth an effort though.

Sit start with hands matched on the jug. From there, work out the overhang on a pair of incut edges, then make a big, left hand move to an edge just before the crater, reel in the feet, match on the crater, continue up and left to the lip, throw a heel on, and mantel atop the boulder.
content.protection: A pair of pads worked well. The landing is good, but there are some rocks near the fall zone of the problem that require padding.
content.location: It climbs the west face overhang of Bygone.
